page.title: 03ST.PETER'S CHURCH, BENINGTON
page.content: (Part 1) In Saxon times a church probably stood on the same site as that now occupied by the present Church.As in those times the Church still stands prominent in Village Life and Character. On entering by the 14th century PORCH through an ancient door, we see an impressive KNAVE. The arches are 14th century and supported on interesting carved corbels probably depicting local characters of that period.The FONT bowl is made of Barnack Stone and it is int- eresting to speculate that babies are still being babtised regularly in the same font as their ancestors over 600 years before.It is dated about 1350 and the base about a century later. (Cont.)
